name: Allileggie SolidarityNow
goal:
SoldarityNow (SN) is an independent charitable, non-profitable organization established in Greece upon an initiative of the Open Society Foundations. The organization’s mission was initially focused on the unfolding Greek financial crisis and those affected the most and contributed to the capacity-building of civil society by offering financial and programmatic support to organisations with the aim of maximizing their impact in times of great necessity.
Since then, SolidarityNow's mission has been re-defined to reflect current needs and social reality amidst the ongoing migration/refugee crisis and is thus multi-fold: to alleviate suffering and accommodate the urgent needs of vulnerable populations and persons of concern, by providing relief and support services via its centres, programme & project development and implementation and partnership-building with national and international stakeholders.
The additional aims that drive SN’s engagement are:
• to empower the local civil society to meet the immediate needs of the community and to build the conditions for a better future;
• to encourage public and private actors from outside Greece to take concrete steps in order to show that Europe is also about solidarity and not only about discipline.

Through its non-discriminatory, human-rights centered and gender-sensitive approach, SolidarityNow provides itsservices to both the local population and aims to reclaim the vision of a strong Europe based on solidarity and open values.
Our Focus Areas
- Civil society support activities supporting and empowering vulnerable groups of the society through multi-level support i.e. Solidarity Centers in Athens and Thessaloniki offering free of charge primary healthcare, legal support and advising, job support and employment readiness, psychosocial support, asylum services, support programmes for parents, children and teenagers;

- Refugee crisis interventions through mobile units in areas of reception of refugees and migrants offering on-site psychosocial support including psychological first aid and legal information; accommodation support in hosting families, apartments and hotels; medical and legal assistance to entry and exit points; support to asylum service; support to first reception service; internet access to the stranded population; cash and food vouchers distribution; capacitating local NGOs’ interventions through re-granting;

- Public information, advocacy and policy reform initiatives focusing on EU Dublin reform; hate crime/racism; citizenship/integration; advocacy on the access to education; alternatives to detention; EU-Turkey deal; unaccompanied minors. SN’s main advocacy activities include participation in national, EU and international events, trainings and social mobilization, participation in fora, networks and joint initiatives, statements, contacts with authorities, research, publication and strategic litigation. Being in the process of consolidating a concrete policy and advocate strategy on several issues, SolidarityNow scales up its visibility and active participation in the international public dialogue.


SolidarityNow is also acting as a grant-making organization providing financial support to implementing partners, in order to continue their operation (i.e. core support) or implement specific projects (i.e. project support).
